title: Insane Lag: How do I determine where it is from?
body: I used to have 36-39 constant ping, recently it has gone up to 52-56 (I don't know why). However, I wouldn't have minded it if it was consistent. My ping spikes up crazy high. Any where between 200 to amounts above 1000 ping. At this point, I don't know what to do, and lose so much because of it. How do I determine the issue? This has been happening even when my normal ping was 36-39 ms. It has always been spiking to insane amounts. How do I find the issue/resolve it?

replies.body:
Hey Adolkas,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.

Hey thanks. 
I did try a wired connection which fixed the problem as the article suggested. However, the problem is that I am a 17 year old teen that is still going to school and so I live with my family. Because my parents do not care for new technology, their pc can on be supported by a direct wired connection. Because of this, the modem is placed in their room upstairs while my room is downstairs and they are unwilling to get a larger cable that runs from upstairs to downstairs. So I need wireless options.

1.  Yes I have tried to the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. Spark
3. Auckland, New Zealand
4. (Sorry how do I link a file on these forums?)
5. In the beginning of this year. It happens very often. Spikes would occur at least once per game at best. Otherwise it may have occured multiple times in a single match and stay for up to 2-5 minutes at a time. It is hard to say how often/how bad as it is difficult to see a pattern. 

6. Sorry, I will get back to you with the Trace Route (Tracert) when i know how to link it.

Thank you.

If you're looking for a wireless option for ethernet, I have your solution! I'd recommend purchasing an Ethernet-Over-Powerline device, such as the one listed below.

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B009WG6K66/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1

You can connect one of the Powerline devices to your router and the other to your computer, and as long as they're on the same powerline, you'll be able to utilize ethernet-fast speeds!
By the way, I meant to use this account to post it. The (NA) account was the account I first made before understanding it was on the wrong server.
